  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
A dramatic moment on Capitol Hill today: the brother
  of former NFL player and Army Ranger Pat Tillman told legislators that the
  military’s account of Tillman’s death was “pure
  fiction.” The Tillman family says they didn’t hear the truth
  – that friendly fire in Afghanistan
  killed Pat – for more than a month after his death. David Martin
  and Jim Axelrod will have reports.
 
It was another bloody day in Iraq – and the deadliest one for U.S. troops
  in more than a year. A suicide bomber in a truck killed nine paratroopers
  from the 82nd Airborne Division and wounded another 20, Mark Strassmann will
  report. And on the domestic front, Sharyl Attkisson will have the latest on
  the Capitol Hill battle over the new Iraq War spending bill.
 
In the race for car sales, Toyota has pulled ahead of General Motors
  for the first time, outselling the American car powerhouse in the first
  quarter of this year. But GM isn’t being left in the dust – a
  slim margin separates the companies’ sales. Anthony Mason will have the
  details.
 
Virginia’s
  governor said today he might be able to close the loophole that allowed
  Seung-Hui Cho to buy the guns he used against Virginia Tech students and
  professors. Wyatt Andrews will have this and more.
 
In an attempt to pressure Congress to extend the No
  Child Left Behind law, President Bush is leaving Washington
  today for a visit to Harlem. The president
  will tour a charter school that has soaring reading scores – even
  though most of the students in the neighborhood live at or near the poverty
  level. Byron Pitts is going along and will bring you the story.
 
Finally, a tale about dogs’ tails. Of course
  animal body language can tell you a lot, but is deciphering your pet’s
  emotion as easy as seeing which direction its tail wags? Richard Schlesinger
  has gone to fetch the story.
 
Thanks!
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
